problem_text: This sample problem involves a tilted applied force, which requires that we work with components to find a frictional force. The main challenge is to sort out all the components. Figure shows a force of magnitude $F=$ $12.0 \mathrm{~N}$ applied to an $8.00 \mathrm{~kg}$ block at a downward angle of $\theta=30.0^{\circ}$. The coefficient of static friction between block and floor is $\mu_s=0.700$; the coefficient of kinetic friction is $\mu_k=0.400$. What is the magnitude of the frictional force on the block?
